name: Fundacja Partnerstwa Technologicznego TECHNOLOGY PARTNERS
membership: The TECHNOLOGY PARTNERS Foundation is a member of such international organisations and associations as: EARTO – the European Association of Research and Technology Organisations (also a Board member) and K4I - Knowledge4Innovation (as a founding member and Board member).
goal:
The TECHNOLOGY PARTNERS Foundation (TPF) is a scientific research and implementation organisation with the status of Advanced Technology Centre awarded by the Minister of Science in 2004, and the Coordinator of the TECHNOLOGY PARTNERS Consortium.

TPF’s mission is to support industry through the transfer of existing and new technologies developed by its partner-institutes, in cooperation with other Polish and foreign research and industrial organisations, with the use of all available national and international instruments.

TPF’s strategic objective is to initiate and support processes aimed at the rational use of knowledge for innovation activity and to undertake practical actions promoting the development of Polish science and technology cooperation with industry. TPF’s experience includes building partnerships and mapping capabilities, and organising and managing participation in international research programmes.

Main areas of activity:

(1) research, analyses and expert opinions in the area of RTD and innovation management
TPF, recognized as an important partner with a strong position in the Polish RTD market, cooperates – providing expert opinions, also reflecting the Polish RTD sector’s position – with Polish authorities, especially the Ministry of Economy, the Ministry of Science and Higher Education, the National Centre for Research and Development and the Polish National Contact Point for Research Programmes of the EU. TPF initiates and takes part in developing national sectoral policies and development programmes relating to strategic areas and issues.

(2) performance and management of multidisciplinary research projects requiring complementary and specialised skills, knowledge and equipment, for Polish and foreign industrial clients, as well as within European programmes.
TPF – through its network of Polish and international research partners – is a virtual interdisciplinary research centre acting as a Polish R&D partner for international organisations, also operating according to framework agreements and other arrangements.
The main objective of TPF and its partners is to develop and perform joint large multidisciplinary projects in strategic research and technology areas and topics. TPF focuses primarily on the following areas: aeronautics and military aviation technology; transport; road, bridge and airport design and construction; applied optics and laser technology; electronics; materials and surface engineering; metals and plastics processing; machine and tool design and construction; logistics and warehousing, as well as many others.

One of TPF’s most important areas of interest is transport, including all related systems-level, economic, organisational and technological issues. The TPF activities in this area include projects performed jointly with its international partners under EU FP7, EU H2020 and research work ordered directly by industrial clients, e.g. AIRBUS.
interests: Business and Industry, Communication, Digital economy and society, International co-operation and development, Research and innovation, Trans-European Networks, Transport
euInitiatives: Through its participation in the European Association of Research and Technology Organisations (EARTO) and KNowledge4Innovation (K4I), the TECHNOLOGY PARTNERS Foundation is active in the area of formulating the bases for EU research and innovation policy making.
